channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: 25. фебруар 2022. https://t.co/qf11Dj5vKW

A good day to remind ourselves that the pseudoscientific nonsense of @sapinker is worse than useless — it is dangerous. https://t.co/hqwfsTdtpX
There is a single explanation for the decline in casualties after WW2, and it is not "being more civilized". Forget that, and you might as well pluck off your feathers and serve yourself up for Thanksgiving (Pinker on the left, reality on the right). https://t.co/Gw1ZU0XpgX
Ko čita samo naslove manje je informisan nego da ništa nije čitao. Ni FT nije imun, ali su i dalje najbolji https://t.co/8p1aFxoU42 https://t.co/xoxoo4TIhm
@slobadoktor Najbolje objašnjenje koje sam našao, od pre dva meseca https://t.co/pPN3XiPtKI
Preporuke za današnji WorLdle (wordle za geografiju) https://t.co/K40Mm8xNIY

@nntaleb @JordanSchachtel Incapacity of IYIs to change opinion and behavior based on new data continues to amaze. They are all like broken clocks cheering for themselves during that fleeting moment when they're right.
What's the deal with journalists and context? https://t.co/jTikHOPsd2

Kucam ovaj tvit iz Vašingtona i opet mislim da je ovakvo razmišljanje idiotsko. Nisu Milošević i njegovi zločinci sedeli u mraku bez struje i vode dok je NATO obarao trafo stanice po Srbiji. https://t.co/WZcfNrxgeJ

"Pieces of the Action" from Vannevar Bush: a wise old man spins some good tales but can't help making bad predictions. It's almost as if you can't have one without the other. https://t.co/KzvbFNeg0X https://t.co/DjWguC701A

"Kripto tehnologija postoji 14 godina, nije razmontirala državu, nije je čak ni ograničila i nema ozbiljnih naznaka da će to u dogledno vreme moći da uradi." Tekstovi @trzisnoresenje su najbolja stvar na srpskom internetu. Srećan rođendan! https://t.co/NLngZKYMUz
@stratechery Excellent article, but @benthompson you should put a negative control on these types of graphs if you claim direct correlation. https://t.co/0FKjRyDcXY

"Kripto tehnologija postoji 14 godina, nije razmontirala državu, nije je čak ni ograničila i nema ozbiljnih naznaka da će to u dogledno vreme moći da uradi." Slavišini tekstovi su najbolja stvar koju možete pročitati na srpskom internetu. Srećan rođendan! [link]

@nntaleb How old was the patient, and are there any measurements prior to the 42mm?
@nntaleb Without going into possible mechanisms: sudden, large changes in anatomy (*not* destruction, like ischemia or bleeding) tend to be rapidly reversible. Slowly progressing ones tend to stick around, and never go back to baseline even if there is some slow improvement.

"The way I dealt with it is by protecting myself from myself, accepting my fallibility to information, and using filters and tricks to get a representation of the world with as little noise as possible without missing on the significant signal" Med research was like this, briefly [link]
Omikron i vakcine u tri slike [link]

Tekst koji svakim danom Bajdenove administracije postaje sve istinitiji. Od danas je v.d. direktora OSTP-a, kanc. za nauku i tehnologiju, sociološkinja koja se bavi uticajem rase i pola na tehnološki napredak. Njen prethodnik, genetičar, smenjen je zbog neprikladnog ponašanja. [link]
@nntaleb In Russia they have another label: useful fools

How does depletion of circulating CD4+ T-cells lead to a clinical hold of a study that investigates anti-CD4 CAR-T therapy? Either there’s more to this story or someone at the FDA is a dummy (and think what you will of the FDA but they’re no dummies) [link]
Crypto as catnip for the neuroatypicals — their very own string theory [link]
Indeed. US makes it hard both to *become* and *be* a doctor. [link]
@KRakszawski This is 3 years old but I think it held up well [link] You may also like the book “A world without email” from Cal Newport.

Brilliant essay. I learned this soon after becoming a parent: I didn’t need more than 4–5 hours of sleep/day. Sure, you get sleepy if bored, but it’s easy not to be bored if you avoid bad lectures, dull books, unnecessary meetings. And the opposites of those get me more animated! [link]
@ArtirKel Interesting parallels to clinical trial protocols. A long process that has many gatekeepers with veto power leads to overstuffed, illegible documents that no one can fully grasp.
@Ljiljana1972 Just like @nntaleb's recollection of the Lebanese civil war. "You know when it starts. Never when it ends…" [link]
NB: US has been "failing" since the 1970s. But there is no better disinfectant than sunshine and clean air. If you wonder about the alternatives look no further than Wuhan. [link]
